verses.text:
Now after the death of Joshua it came to pass, that the children
of Israel asked the \nd LORD\nd*, saying, Who shall go up for us against the
Canaanites first, to fight against them?

And the \nd LORD\nd* said, Judah shall go up: behold, I have
delivered the land into his hand.

And Judah said unto Simeon his brother, Come up with me into my
lot, that we may fight against the Canaanites; and I likewise will
go with thee into thy lot. So Simeon went with him.

And Judah went up; and the \nd LORD\nd* delivered the Canaanites
and the Perizzites into their hand: and they slew of them in Bezek
ten thousand men.

And they found Adoni-bezek in Bezek: and they fought against him, and they
slew the Canaanites and the Perizzites.

But Adoni-bezek fled; and they pursued after him, and caught
him, and cut off his thumbs and his great toes.

And Adoni-bezek said, Threescore and ten kings, having their
thumbs and their great toes cut off, gathered \add their meat\add*
under my table: as I have done, so God hath requited me. And they
brought him to Jerusalem, and there he died.\f + \fr 1.7  \ft their thumbs…: Heb. the thumbs of their hands and of their
feet\f*\f + \fr 1.7  \ft gathered: or, gleaned\f*

Now the children of Judah had fought against Jerusalem, and had
taken it, and smitten it with the edge of the sword, and set the
city on fire.

And afterward the children of Judah went down to fight against the
Canaanites, that dwelt in the mountain, and in the south, and in the
valley.\f + \fr 1.9  \ft valley: or, low country\f*

And Judah went against the Canaanites that dwelt in Hebron:
(now the name of Hebron before \add was\add* Kirjath-arba:) and they
slew Sheshai, and Ahiman, and Talmai.

And from thence he went against the inhabitants of Debir:
and the name of Debir before \add was\add* Kirjath-sepher:

And Caleb said, He that smiteth Kirjath-sepher, and taketh
it, to him will I give Achsah my daughter to wife.

And Othniel the son of Kenaz, Caleb’s younger brother, took
it: and he gave him Achsah his daughter to wife.

And it came to pass, when she came \add to him\add*, that she
moved him to ask of her father a field: and she lighted from off
\add her\add* ass; and Caleb said unto her, What wilt thou?

And she said unto him, Give me a blessing: for thou hast given
me a south land; give me also springs of water. And Caleb gave her the
upper springs and the nether springs.

And the children of the Kenite, Moses’ father in law, went
up out of the city of palm trees with the children of Judah into the
wilderness of Judah, which \add lieth\add* in the south of Arad;
and they went and dwelt among the people.

And Judah went with Simeon his brother, and they slew the
Canaanites that inhabited Zephath, and utterly destroyed it. And the
name of the city was called Hormah.

Also Judah took Gaza with the coast thereof, and Askelon with the
coast thereof, and Ekron with the coast thereof.

And the \nd LORD\nd* was with Judah; and he drave out \add the inhabitants
of\add* the mountain; but could not drive out the inhabitants of the
valley, because they had chariots of iron.\f + \fr 1.19  \ft drave…: or, possessed the
mountain\f*

And they gave Hebron unto Caleb, as Moses said: and he expelled
thence the three sons of Anak.

And the children of Benjamin did not drive out the Jebusites
that inhabited Jerusalem; but the Jebusites dwell with the children
of Benjamin in Jerusalem unto this day.

And the house of Joseph, they also went up against Beth-el:
and the \nd LORD\nd* \add was\add* with them.

And the house of Joseph sent to descry Beth-el. (Now the name
of the city before \add was\add* Luz.)

And the spies saw a man come forth out of the city, and they
said unto him, Shew us, we pray thee, the entrance into the city,
and we will shew thee mercy.

And when he shewed them the entrance into the city, they smote
the city with the edge of the sword; but they let go the man and all his
family.

And the man went into the land of the Hittites, and built
a city, and called the name thereof Luz: which \add is\add* the name
thereof unto this day.

Neither did Manasseh drive out \add the inhabitants of\add*
Beth-shean and her towns, nor Taanach and her towns, nor the inhabitants
of Dor and her towns, nor the inhabitants of Ibleam and her towns,
nor the inhabitants of Megiddo and her towns: but the Canaanites
would dwell in that land.

And it came to pass, when Israel was strong, that they put
the Canaanites to tribute, and did not utterly drive them out.

Neither did Ephraim drive out the Canaanites that dwelt in
Gezer; but the Canaanites dwelt in Gezer among them.

Neither did Zebulun drive out the inhabitants of Kitron,
nor the inhabitants of Nahalol; but the Canaanites dwelt among them, and became
tributaries.

Neither did Asher drive out the inhabitants of Accho, nor the
inhabitants of Zidon, nor of Ahlab, nor of Achzib, nor of Helbah,
nor of Aphik, nor of Rehob:

But the Asherites dwelt among the Canaanites, the inhabitants
of the land: for they did not drive them out.

Neither did Naphtali drive out the inhabitants of Beth-shemesh,
nor the inhabitants of Beth-anath; but he dwelt among the Canaanites,
the inhabitants of the land: nevertheless the inhabitants of Beth-shemesh
and of Beth-anath became tributaries unto them.

And the Amorites forced the children of Dan into the mountain:
for they would not suffer them to come down to the valley:

But the Amorites would dwell in mount Heres in Aijalon, and in
Shaalbim: yet the hand of the house of Joseph prevailed, so that they became
tributaries.\f + \fr 1.35  \ft prevailed: Heb. was heavy\f*

And the coast of the Amorites \add was\add* from the going
up to Akrabbim, from the rock, and upward.\f + \fr 1.36  \ft the going…: or,
Maaleh-acrabbim\f*

And an angel of the \nd LORD\nd* came up from Gilgal to Bochim,
and said, I made you to go up out of Egypt, and have brought you unto the
land which I sware unto your fathers; and I said, I will never break
my covenant with you.\f + \fr 2.1  \ft angel: or, messenger\f*

Wherefore I also said, I will not drive them out from before you; but they shall be
\add as thorns\add* in your sides, and their gods shall be a snare unto you.

And it came to pass, when the angel of the \nd LORD\nd* spake
these words unto all the children of Israel, that the people lifted
up their voice, and wept.

And they called the name of that place Bochim: and they sacrificed
there unto the \nd LORD\nd*.\f + \fr 2.5  \ft Bochim: that is, Weepers\f*

And when Joshua had let the people go, the children of Israel
went every man unto his inheritance to possess the land.

And the people served the \nd LORD\nd* all the days of Joshua,
and all the days of the elders that outlived Joshua, who had seen
all the great works of the \nd LORD\nd*, that he did for Israel.\f + \fr 2.7 
\ft outlived: Heb. prolonged days after\f*

And Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of the \nd LORD\nd*,
died, \add being\add* an hundred and ten years old.

And they buried him in the border of his inheritance in Timnath-heres,
in the mount of Ephraim, on the north side of the hill Gaash.\f + \fr 2.9 
\ft Timnath-heres: also called, Timnath-serah\f*

And also all that generation were gathered unto their fathers:
and there arose another generation after them, which knew not the
\nd LORD\nd*, nor yet the works which he had done for Israel.

And the children of Israel did evil in the sight of the \nd LORD\nd*,
and served Baalim:

And they forsook the \nd LORD\nd* God of their fathers, which brought them
out of the land of Egypt, and followed other gods, of the gods of the
people that \add were\add* round about them, and bowed themselves unto them, and provoked the
\nd LORD\nd* to anger.
And they forsook the \nd LORD\nd*, and served Baal and Ashtaroth.

And the anger of the \nd LORD\nd* was hot against Israel,
and he delivered them into the hands of spoilers that spoiled them, and he
sold them into the hands of their enemies round about, so that they
could not any longer stand before their enemies.

Whithersoever they went out, the hand of the 
d LORD
d*
was against them for evil, as the 
d LORD
d* had said, and as the

d LORD
d* had sworn unto them: and they were greatly distressed.

Nevertheless the \nd LORD\nd* raised up judges, which delivered
them out of the hand of those that spoiled them.\f + \fr 2.16  \ft delivered: Heb.
saved\f*

And yet they would not hearken unto their judges, but they went a
whoring after other gods, and bowed themselves unto them: they turned
quickly out of the way which their fathers walked in, obeying the
commandments of the \nd LORD\nd*; \add but\add* they did not so.

And when the 
d LORD
d* raised them up judges, then the

d LORD
d* was with the judge, and delivered them out of the hand
of their enemies all the days of the judge: for it repented the 
d LORD
d*
because of their groanings by reason of them that oppressed them and
vexed them.

And it came to pass, when the judge was dead, \add that\add*
they returned, and corrupted \add themselves\add* more than their
fathers, in following other gods to serve them, and to bow down unto them; they
ceased not from their own doings, nor from their stubborn way.\f + \fr 2.19 
\ft corrupted…: or, were corrupt\f*\f + \fr 2.19  \ft ceased…: Heb. let nothing fall of
their\f*

I also will not henceforth drive out any from before them of the
nations which Joshua left when he died:

That through them I may prove Israel, whether they will keep
the way of the \nd LORD\nd* to walk therein, as their fathers did
keep \add it\add*, or not.

Therefore the \nd LORD\nd* left those nations, without driving them
out hastily; neither delivered he them into the hand of Joshua.\f + \fr 2.23 
\ft left: or, suffered\f*

Only that the generations of the children of Israel might know,
to teach them war, at the least such as before knew nothing thereof;

\add Namely\add*, five lords of the Philistines, and all the
Canaanites, and the Sidonians, and the Hivites that dwelt in mount
Lebanon, from mount Baal-hermon unto the entering in of Hamath.

And they were to prove Israel by them, to know whether they would
hearken unto the commandments of the \nd LORD\nd*, which he commanded
their fathers by the hand of Moses.

And the children of Israel dwelt among the Canaanites, Hittites,
and Amorites, and Perizzites, and Hivites, and Jebusites:

And they took their daughters to be their wives, and gave their
daughters to their sons, and served their gods.

And the children of Israel did evil in the sight of the \nd LORD\nd*,
and forgat the \nd LORD\nd* their God, and served Baalim and the
groves.

Therefore the anger of the \nd LORD\nd* was hot against Israel,
and he sold them into the hand of Chushan-rishathaim king of Mesopotamia:
and the children of Israel served Chushan-rishathaim eight years.\f + \fr 3.8 
\ft Mesopotamia: Heb. Aram-naharaim\f*

And when the children of Israel cried unto the \nd LORD\nd*,
the \nd LORD\nd* raised up a deliverer to the children of Israel,
who delivered them, \add even\add* Othniel the son of Kenaz, Caleb’s
younger brother.\f + \fr 3.9  \ft deliverer: Heb. saviour\f*

And the Spirit of the \nd LORD\nd* came upon him, and he judged
Israel, and went out to war: and the \nd LORD\nd* delivered Chushan-rishathaim
king of Mesopotamia into his hand; and his hand prevailed  against
Chushan-rishathaim.\f + \fr 3.10  \ft came: Heb. was\f*\f + \fr 3.10 
\ft Mesopotamia: Heb. Aram\f*

And the land had rest forty years. And Othniel the son of
Kenaz died.

And the children of Israel did evil again in the sight of the

d LORD
d*: and the 
d LORD
d* strengthened Eglon the king of
Moab against Israel, because they had done evil in the sight of the

d LORD
d*.

And he gathered unto him the children of Ammon and Amalek,
and went and smote Israel, and possessed the city of palm trees.

So the children of Israel served Eglon the king of Moab eighteen
years.

But when the children of Israel cried unto the \nd LORD\nd*,
the \nd LORD\nd* raised them up a deliverer, Ehud the son of Gera,
a Benjamite, a man lefthanded: and by him the children of Israel
sent a present unto Eglon the king of Moab.\f + \fr 3.15  \ft a Benjamite: or, the son of
Jemini\f*\f + \fr 3.15  \ft lefthanded: Heb. shut of his right hand\f*

But Ehud made him a dagger which had two edges, of a cubit
length; and he did gird it under his raiment upon his right thigh.

And he brought the present unto Eglon king of Moab: and Eglon
\add was\add* a very fat man.

And when he had made an end to offer the present, he sent
away the people that bare the present.

But he himself turned again from the quarries that \add were\add*
by Gilgal, and said, I have a secret errand unto thee, O king: who
said, Keep silence. And all that stood by him went out from him.\f + \fr 3.19 
\ft quarries: or, graven images\f*

And Ehud came unto him; and he was sitting in a summer parlour,
which he had for himself alone. And Ehud said, I have a message from
God unto thee. And he arose out of \add his\add* seat.\f + \fr 3.20 
\ft a summer…: Heb. a parlour of cooling\f*

And Ehud put forth his left hand, and took the dagger from his
right thigh, and thrust it into his belly:

And the haft also went in after the blade; and the fat closed
upon the blade, so that he could not draw the dagger out of his belly;
and the dirt came out.\f + \fr 3.22  \ft the dirt…: or, it came out at the
buttocks\f*

Then Ehud went forth through the porch, and shut the doors
of the parlour upon him, and locked them.

When he was gone out, his servants came; and when they saw
that, behold, the doors of the parlour \add were\add* locked, they
said, Surely he covereth his feet in his summer chamber.\f + \fr 3.24 
\ft covereth…: or, doeth his easement\f*

And they tarried till they were ashamed: and, behold, he opened
not the doors of the parlour; therefore they took a key, and opened
\add them:\add* and, behold, their lord \add was\add* fallen down
dead on the earth.

And Ehud escaped while they tarried, and passed beyond the
quarries, and escaped unto Seirath.

And it came to pass, when he was come, that he blew a trumpet
in the mountain of Ephraim, and the children of Israel went down
with him from the mount, and he before them.

And he said unto them, Follow after me: for the \nd LORD\nd*
hath delivered your enemies the Moabites into your hand. And they went
down after him, and took the fords of Jordan toward Moab, and suffered
not a man to pass over.

And they slew of Moab at that time about ten thousand men,
all lusty, and all men of valour; and there escaped not a man.\f + \fr 3.29 
\ft lusty: Heb. fat\f*

So Moab was subdued that day under the hand of Israel. And the
land had rest fourscore years.

And after him was Shamgar the son of Anath, which slew of the
Philistines six hundred men with an ox goad: and he also delivered
Israel.

And the children of Israel again did evil in the sight of the
\nd LORD\nd*, when Ehud was dead.

And the \nd LORD\nd* sold them into the hand of Jabin king
of Canaan, that reigned in Hazor; the captain of whose host \add was\add*
Sisera, which dwelt in Harosheth of the Gentiles.

And the children of Israel cried unto the \nd LORD\nd*: for he had
nine hundred chariots of iron; and twenty years he mightily oppressed
the children of Israel.

And Deborah, a prophetess, the wife of Lapidoth, she judged
Israel at that time.

And she dwelt under the palm tree of Deborah between Ramah
and Beth-el in mount Ephraim: and the children of Israel came up
to her for judgment.

And she sent and called Barak the son of Abinoam out of Kedesh-naphtali,
and said unto him, Hath not the \nd LORD\nd* God of Israel commanded,
\add saying\add*, Go and draw toward mount Tabor, and take with thee
ten thousand men of the children of Naphtali and of the children
of Zebulun?

And I will draw unto thee to the river Kishon Sisera, the captain
of Jabin’s army, with his chariots and his multitude; and I will
deliver him into thine hand.

And Barak said unto her, If thou wilt go with me, then I will
go: but if thou wilt not go with me, \add then\add* I will not go.

And she said, I will surely go with thee: notwithstanding the
journey that thou takest shall not be for thine honour; for the \nd LORD\nd*
shall sell Sisera into the hand of a woman. And Deborah arose, and
went with Barak to Kedesh.

And Barak called Zebulun and Naphtali to Kedesh; and he went
up with ten thousand men at his feet: and Deborah went up with him.

Now Heber the Kenite, \add which was\add* of the children
of Hobab the father in law of Moses, had severed himself from the
Kenites, and pitched his tent unto the plain of Zaanaim, which \add is\add*
by Kedesh.

And they shewed Sisera that Barak the son of Abinoam was gone
up to mount Tabor.

And Sisera gathered together all his chariots, \add even\add*
nine hundred chariots of iron, and all the people that \add were\add*
with him, from Harosheth of the Gentiles unto the river of Kishon.\f + \fr 4.13 
\ft together: Heb. by cry, or, proclamation\f*

And Deborah said unto Barak, Up; for this \add is\add* the
day in which the \nd LORD\nd* hath delivered Sisera into thine hand:
is not the \nd LORD\nd* gone out before thee? So Barak went down
from mount Tabor, and ten thousand men after him.

And the \nd LORD\nd* discomfited  Sisera, and all \add his\add*
chariots, and all \add his\add* host, with the edge of the sword
before Barak; so that Sisera lighted down off \add his\add* chariot,
and fled away on his feet.

But Barak pursued after the chariots, and after the host,
unto Harosheth of the Gentiles: and all the host of Sisera fell upon the
edge of the sword; \add and\add* there was not a man left.\f + \fr 4.16 
\ft a man: Heb. unto one\f*

Howbeit Sisera fled away on his feet to the tent of Jael the
wife of Heber the Kenite: for \add there was\add* peace between Jabin
the king of Hazor and the house of Heber the Kenite.

And Jael went out to meet Sisera, and said unto him, Turn
in, my lord, turn in to me; fear not. And when he had turned in unto her into the
tent, she covered him with a mantle.\f + \fr 4.18  \ft mantle: or, rug, or,
blanket\f*

And he said unto her, Give me, I pray thee, a little water
to drink; for I am thirsty. And she opened a bottle of milk, and gave him
drink, and covered him.

Again he said unto her, Stand in the door of the tent, and it shall be, when any
man doth come and enquire of thee, and say, Is there any man here?
that thou shalt say, No.

Then Jael Heber’s wife took a nail of the tent, and took an
hammer in her hand, and went softly unto him, and smote the nail
into his temples, and fastened it into the ground: for he was fast
asleep and weary. So he died.\f + \fr 4.21  \ft and took: Heb. and
put\f*

And, behold, as Barak pursued  Sisera, Jael came out to meet
him, and said unto him, Come, and I will shew thee the man whom thou
seekest. And when he came into her \add tent\add*, behold, Sisera
lay dead, and the nail \add was\add* in his temples.

So God subdued on that day Jabin the king of Canaan before
the children of Israel.

And the hand of the children of Israel prospered, and prevailed
against Jabin the king of Canaan, until they had destroyed Jabin
king of Canaan.\f + \fr 4.24  \ft prospered…: Heb. going went and was
hard\f*

Then sang Deborah and Barak the son of Abinoam on that day,
saying,

Praise ye the \nd LORD\nd* for the avenging of Israel, when the
people willingly offered themselves.

Hear, O ye kings; give ear, O ye princes; I, \add even\add*
I, will sing unto the 
d LORD
d*; I will sing \add praise\add*
to the 
d LORD
d* God of Israel.

\nd LORD\nd*, when thou wentest out of Seir, when thou marchedst
out of the field of Edom, the earth trembled, and the heavens dropped,
the clouds also dropped water.

The mountains melted from before the \nd LORD\nd*, \add even\add*
that Sinai from before the \nd LORD\nd* God of Israel.\f + \fr 5.5 
\ft melted: Heb. flowed\f*

In the days of Shamgar the son of Anath, in the days of Jael,
the highways were unoccupied, and the travellers walked through byways.\f + \fr 5.6 
\ft travellers: Heb. walkers of paths\f*\f + \fr 5.6  \ft byways: Heb. crooked
ways\f*

\add The inhabitants of\add* the villages ceased, they ceased
in Israel, until that I Deborah arose, that I arose a mother in Israel.

They chose new gods; then \add was\add* war in the gates: was there a
shield or spear seen among forty thousand in Israel?

My heart \add is\add* toward the governors of Israel, that offered themselves
willingly among the people. Bless ye the \nd LORD\nd*.

Speak, ye that ride on white asses, ye that sit in judgment,
and walk by the way.\f + \fr 5.10  \ft Speak: or, Meditate\f*

\add They that are delivered\add* from the noise of archers
in the places of drawing water, there shall they rehearse the righteous
acts of the \nd LORD\nd*, \add even\add* the righteous acts \add toward the
inhabitants\add* of his villages in Israel: then shall the people
of the \nd LORD\nd* go down to the gates.\f + \fr 5.11  \ft righteous…: Heb.
righteousnesses\f*

Awake, awake, Deborah: awake, awake, utter a song: arise,
Barak, and lead thy captivity captive, thou son of Abinoam.

Then he made him that remaineth have dominion over the nobles
among the people: the \nd LORD\nd* made me have dominion over the
mighty.

Out of Ephraim \add was there\add* a root of them against
Amalek; after thee, Benjamin, among thy people; out of Machir came
down governors, and out of Zebulun they that handle the pen of the
writer.\f + \fr 5.14  \ft handle: Heb. draw with\f*

And the princes of Issachar \add were\add* with Deborah; even
Issachar, and also Barak: he was sent on foot into the valley. For the
divisions of Reuben \add there were\add* great thoughts of heart.\f + \fr 5.15 
\ft foot: Heb. his feet\f*\f + \fr 5.15  \ft thoughts: Heb. impressions\f*\f + \fr 5.15 
\ft For: or, In\f*

Why abodest thou among the sheepfolds, to hear the bleatings
of the flocks? For the divisions of Reuben \add there were\add* great
searchings of heart.\f + \fr 5.16  \ft For: or, In\f*

Gilead abode beyond Jordan: and why did Dan remain in ships?
Asher continued on the sea shore, and abode in his breaches.\f + \fr 5.17 
\ft shore: or, port\f*\f + \fr 5.17  \ft breaches: or, creeks\f*

Zebulun and Naphtali \add were\add* a people \add that\add*
jeoparded their lives unto the death in the high places of the field.\f + \fr 5.18 
\ft jeoparded: Heb. exposed to reproach\f*

The kings came \add and\add* fought, then fought the kings
of Canaan in Taanach by the waters of Megiddo; they took no gain
of money.

They fought from heaven; the stars in their courses fought
against Sisera.\f + \fr 5.20  \ft courses: Heb. paths\f*

The river of Kishon swept them away, that ancient river, the
river Kishon. O my soul, thou hast trodden down strength.

Then were the horsehoofs broken by the means of the pransings,
the pransings of their mighty ones.\f + \fr 5.22  \ft pransings: or, tramplings, or,
plungings\f*

Curse ye Meroz, said the angel of the 
d LORD
d*, curse
ye bitterly the inhabitants thereof; because they came not to the
help of the 
d LORD
d*, to the help of the 
d LORD
d* against the
mighty.

Blessed above women shall Jael the wife of Heber the Kenite
be, blessed shall she be above women in the tent.

He asked water, \add and\add* she gave \add him\add* milk;
she brought forth butter in a lordly dish.

She put her hand to the nail, and her right hand to the workmen’s
hammer; and with the hammer she smote Sisera, she smote off his head,
when she had pierced and stricken through his temples.\f + \fr 5.26 
\ft with…: Heb. she hammered\f*

At her feet he bowed, he fell, he lay down: at her feet he
bowed, he fell: where he bowed, there he fell down dead.\f + \fr 5.27 
\ft At: Heb. Between\f*\f + \fr 5.27  \ft dead: Heb. destroyed\f*

The mother of Sisera looked out at a window, and cried through the
lattice, Why is his chariot \add so\add* long in coming? why tarry
the wheels of his chariots?

Her wise ladies answered her, yea, she returned answer to
herself,\f + \fr 5.29  \ft answer: Heb. her words\f*

Have they not sped? have they \add not\add* divided the prey;
to every man a damsel \add or\add* two; to Sisera a prey of divers
colours, a prey of divers colours of needlework, of divers colours
of needlework on both sides, \add meet\add* for the necks of \add them that
take\add* the spoil?\f + \fr 5.30  \ft every…: Heb. the head of a
man\f*

So let all thine enemies perish, O \nd LORD\nd*: but \add let\add*
them that love him \add be\add* as the sun when he goeth forth in his
might. And the land had rest forty years.

And the children of Israel did evil in the sight of the 
d LORD
d*:
and the 
d LORD
d* delivered them into the hand of Midian seven
years.

And the hand of Midian prevailed against Israel: \add and\add*
because of the Midianites the children of Israel made them the dens which
\add are\add* in the mountains, and caves, and strong holds.\f + \fr 6.2 
\ft prevailed: Heb. was strong\f*

And they encamped against them, and destroyed the increase
of the earth, till thou come unto Gaza, and left no sustenance for
Israel, neither sheep, nor ox, nor ass.\f + \fr 6.4  \ft sheep: or
goat\f*

For they came up with their cattle and their tents, and they
came as grasshoppers for multitude; \add for\add* both they and their
camels were without number: and they entered into the land to destroy it.

And Israel was greatly impoverished because of the Midianites;
and the children of Israel cried unto the \nd LORD\nd*.

And it came to pass, when the children of Israel cried unto the
\nd LORD\nd* because of the Midianites,

That the \nd LORD\nd* sent a prophet unto the children of Israel,
